1253221221112211211.content:
Morgan gulped, it seemed either Regina had gotten there quicker than expected or he took longer than he thought to find most of the ingredients for the ritual than he thought. He didn't have much more time to think as he was lifted and pulled into an apple scented embrace, squirming a wriggling in an attempt to escape but whoever it was they were able to keep a firm grip on the young prince. Finally he was released at the doorway of Regina's crypt where the woman herself was standing in a her sized dressing gown angrily tapping her foot, Henry standing by her heel in pyjamas, answering Morgan's internal question as it meant Emma was his 'captor'

'Morgan what did I tell you yesterday? You are too young to do this by yourself, and I had already agreed to assist you in this endeavour. You couldn't even give it long enough to wake up and have breakfast could you kiddo?' The tone was irritated with a little teasing underneath, reminding him of Aversa when she spoke to Ylssians, something she really hated doing

'I'm sorry Regina, but I need to do this as soon as I can, they're my family. Plus I can't bring you into this insanity, even with your current size Grima is much bigger and more powerful, if she turned her attention to Storybrooke she could destroy it easily'

Regina sighed 'Morgan she already has my town in her sights given Noire was her first wave for lack of a better term. She would get here eventually so it only makes sense I would assist in keeping her out. Besides, I have 30 years more magical experience than you little guy, that should help with this plan you obviously have to stop the great evil'

Morgan nods slightly 'Yeah I do have a plan, use the ancient ritual to form the legendary Pure Falchion which is the only thing that could banish an eternal power like Grima, given what it did to Dumat and Mila in the legend'

'Good we've actually got a plan' Emma sighed in relief, she really didn't like the idea of facing giant mages and a god, just winging it.

'Yeah, but the problem is one of the ingredients, a shattered heart of darkness' Morgan admitted then looks up to Regina 'You had everything except that in your storage, which makes things a little easier'

Regina bit her lip before sliding to her knees 'Actually, I might have that last piece as well' her eyes flickered skittishly worrying not only Morgan but Henry and Emma as well 'Emma go back into my vault, there should be shelves behind the curtain. Check for the blackest crystal heart you can find and bring it and a beaker back up to us' the blond nods and runs down, Morgan looked confused and Henry shrugged

Emma returned quickly with a nearly pure black heart, only little flickers of red streaking across it's core. 'Thank you Emma, now give the heart to me and hold the beaker beneath my hand' she orders, holding the heart between her forefinger and thumb, before with a motion similar to sprinkling a pinch of salt she crushed the heart to a black powder, which the blond Sherriff caught easily 'There you go Morgan, the darkest heart I had besides my own shattered for your ritual'

Morgan and Henry gapped 'What just happened?'

'I crushed the heart of one of my former enemies, their sacrifice will not be in vain if it banishes this demon goddess...'

'Actually she's an dragon' Morgan corrects, then blushes when all eyes turn to him 'That's kind of the problem, all True Dragons go feral and homicidal eventually, Grima just took longer than the others did'

'Still we now have all the parts for this ritual, anything else?' Emma asks, sensing a but in her future (other than Regina's)

'Um yeah, it needs a mage class magical, which I'm not old enough to have reached the level of, Lucina was one and Noire is on the threshold of one, not that it helps as she can't access her magic in the cage and she's Grima's puppet outside it. So yeah despite my attempt to do this myself.... I need your help Regina, you're the only mage in Storybrooke'

Regina nods in understanding 'Okay Morgan, we'll do this somewhere safe.... which at the moment means my home. So you will be fed and dressed properly like you were supposed to, then we shall craft your god slayer' Morgan sighs but agrees to Regina's stipulations, she did have a point as his stomach was starting to growl

'Okay, but just so you know if this doesn't work I'm going with Plan B and pulling some of those magic fruits from that universe I ended up in when I zagged instead of zigged getting here and using them on us. If it hadn't been for Scales I'd still be stuck there just so you know' the tactician comments, getting an amused chuckle form the adults, while Henry had a thinking face as the world sounded familiar

With a twist of her wrist the 4 of them (and all Morgan's items) returned to the house, the kitchen specifically where Noire's cage had already been moved, the archer working her way through a grape the size of her breasts (as the food had been grown to Regina's size when she reformed the house)

After everyone had been fed, dressed and ready for the day, what happens?

125322122111221122.content:
All was quiet in Regina's bedroom, until there was an almighty roar....

'BACON!!!!!' Noire yelled, bouncing out of bed and walking right into the magical bars of her cage, trying to claw her way out like a wild animal to get at her cooked meats. This commotion was what ultimately woke the boys

'Is she always like that?' Henry asked looking a little disturbed (possibly left over from last nights conversation with the rabid archer)

Morgan shrugs before sniffing the air 'Not usually but I do smell bacon. Aunt Tharja may not be the best cook, but she knows how to make delicious meat, to the point her and Gregor have monthly contests and win equally over all. Tharja's ham is unbeatable, but Gregor makes real good sausage' he explains, seeing in the boys eyes he got the scent too, and not a moment too soon as they were all poofed down to the kitchen, where Emma was munching away on giant food and Regina was cooking just beyond them.

'Mine!' Noire hisses, trying to reach some of the slices, the ferocity even causing Emma to put down her rasher

'Should we be worried?' she asks as Regina comes over with a couple waffles for them all

'Just throw her a couple rashers and she'll be fine' Morgan answers flatly, the adults shrug amongst themselves but follow his instructions, Noire pouncing on them like a Tasmanian Devil, till all that remained was the usually petit woman, with a bulging stomach and content groans

'It's not mama's, but it was goooooood' she coos happily before drifting to sleep again, Morgan laughing as the others just stare at the once more unconscious woman

'This happen often?'

'The food coma? Yeah sometimes, usually when Tharja and Gregor have their contests as they make a LOT of food and there's usually some left over right until she gets to it' Morgan explains, then he sees the chunk of waffle, egg and single slice of bacon himself and Henry had each been given, Emma getting one waffle and egg, as well as 2 slices of bacon herself, while Regina got a mound of food Henry would usually associate with his blond mother

'Well dig in boys, need to get your strength up if you want to get this ritual done quickly, well if magic over there is as taxing as it is here' Regina says, trying to encourage them to eat, something Emma needed no help in of course. Morgan nodded and pulled a chunk of egg and stuffed it in his mouth, smiling as he did: it wasn't Cherche's level but damn was it good

Regina could see his expression and smiled back 'I'm glad you enjoy it, you'll need all the energy you can get' she nods as Emma is almost done and Henry has started on his waffle. In the end the boys didn't finish their meals (so Regina did for them) and Emma looked about ready to pass out into a similar food coma to Noire if not for Regina's death glares of 'Don't leave me here alone with the children' which perked her up immediately

'And now we save the world' Morgan announces confidently, waking up Noire who half heartedly raises her arm in solidarity, rolling her eyes at Morgan enthusiasm as well as energy

What now?

Soon all the ingredients were gathered, the Once people noting Morgan had made a circle with different symbols which had Falchion in the center of it. Regina and Morgan were on either side of the circle and preformed the chant Falchion now glowing blue until there was a massive flash of light. In the center of the circle was Falchion now glowing blue in the center, blue runes across the blade itself. Morgan gingerly picked it up. The crypt above them was lifted and obliterated by the dark magic emanating from the being above them. Snow white hair, glowing red eyes with tattoos leading out to form a set of eyes above and below her own, her impressive bust somehow contained by her coat. 'FUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUCK!!!!!!!!!!!' Okay that wasn't what she expected, but Aversa was also known for her colourful language, despite Robin's efforts to get her to stop doing so in front of the kids (aka just Morgan if we're being honest)

'Well, well Noire how can you disobey me?' Now normally they'd all be screwed, except Regina had the foresight to ensure they were all close enough to one another she could poof them all away together, after grabbing the Pure Falchion (an action that shocked both Morgan and Noire, Grima being too large to see), narrowly escaping the destruction caused by Grima's enchanted black fire.

Regina poofed them all back to her place, for once feeling odd about her living arrangements as she as currently just as small in the giantess sized mansion as the others

Regina may be our best chance to save our moms from Grima's spell' the archer nods and pulls Morgan into a comforting hug, though who was comforting who is up for debate

'Yes Morgan'

What now?

Time skip

It was one of these similar boring days for Belle, as a servant for Rumplestiltskin in his Mansion. Always doing the same tasks while he was away. Only this time she had smile on her face, as things were improving somehow. She knew after their little talk a day before, that he was not the beast he pretented to be. It was a good day, until she noticed something's strange while cleaning the dinner table : the rose that Rumple offered to her the day before, disappeared. She looked disapointed, wondering if Rumple was in a bad mood today and just made the flower disappeared.

But then she heard something inside the vase. She approached it carefully to check what was doing some noises. The diminutive form of what seemed like Gaston just looked up : " Belle !! You're alive !!" he yelled in victory.

Belle was frozen of stupefaction : " Gaston...what's i going on ? Why are you here and sooo...tiny ? "

" All i remember is that the fuckin'g beast turned me into a rose as i came to save you from him !! " He replied with anger.

" Oh my..." Belle then flipped the vase, allowing Gaston to come out. " Are you..okay ? I mean no injuries or something ? " she asked worried as she remembered she cut a part of the rose to make it fit into the vase.

Gaston checked his arms and muscles first, with an arrogant attitude as usual. " No i'm not ! I want my size back ! Then i'll kill the beast for you once and for all ! "the tiny guy swipped out his sword from his belt ready for a fight.

At first Belle was relieved he was not injuried because of her, but now, seeing him still himself, she was already annoyed. Things would have probably be better if only he remained a rose for the rest of his life...She felt evil by thinking that way, but not guilty.

" HEY ! Heard me ? We need something to fix my size ! You have to do this quickly before he returns ! "

You will Miss Swan, it's just a wish away' she smirked and poofed into Regina's office setting herself down while she waited for the woman to be free.

About 10 minutes later Regina finally arrived ''So what was the issue?' she asked taking her usual seat as Maleficent reached into her breast pocket and pulled the tiny man out before gently placing him on the table

What's Regina's answer?

The girl arrived at Henry's door and knocked at it.

" Henry it's me Ivy, i wanna talk with you ! " she said.

The tiny confused man saw the chance to get help, thought he was not sure if he could trust her not, he knew she was nice with him these last times and even confessed her problems with him. He also suspected she was in love with him but decided to ignore it as he didn't feel the same for her...But for now he needed some help.

" IVY !! I'M HERE ! " he yelled, thought that he knew she wouldn't hear him. He tried to think about something else to get her attention, when...he suddenly heard the door opening.

"Does she have a key of my home or something ? " he wondered, still undertain to know what was going on.

Ivy entered Henry's home, and checked everything including his own room.

As tempting as the idea of Barry squirming under her toes felt, Caitlin knew she couldn't even if only because she didn't want to irritate Barry to the point he wanted someone else this early (she had so many plans for him, she really needed to write them down) so with an internal sigh she stood over her shoes, making sure Barry could see her from his position ''Hey Bear, have a nice sleep, I know I did. Now I need to take you out of my shoe so I can wear them, sure this could be a good form of transport if we need it, but we're still trying to determine your limits so let's leave it for now'' Caitlin greeted and said with a cheery grin, noting how Barry practically flinched at the thought of being under her feet for that long, guess he deserves somewhere else as a change of scenery. Without any warning she plucks Barry from her shoe and slides him into her bra, which was still visible under her half open shirt ''Cait!'' Barry yelled in embarrassment but she continued to smile ''Oh Barry, my girls got you here, which means they can definitely get you back to Star Labs, you'll be fine'' Caitlin placated as she did up her buttons, slowly entombing him between her breasts.
Once her face was out of Barry's field of vision she smirked, some things were just too easy. Slipping on her shoes and slightly regretting the lack of a little red addition, she exited and locked her apartment before heading to her car and driving back to STAR labs. When she arrived she wondered how Cisco and Wells were doing in the hunt for the shrinking meta, Cisco already probably giving her some kind of name like Dr mini, or Nanocloud but most likely not having any luck with actually finding the size changer if the lack of any contact after getting home was any indication. She also wondered how the Wests were taking the news about Barry's condition, not well she presumed but it showed what they thought of her skills that they also didn't text or ring her asking about Barry.
Her mind then began to wander to random things she could do with Barry, or even with the new meta's powers when she walked past the lab Jesse usually worked out of: usually working on ways to upgrade the STAR labs tech or the do-dads her father brought over from Earth-2, Jesse Wells was every bit a tinkerer as the non-evil Harrison they were getting know, and it was clear he was where she got all her sarcasm and wit. It was actually this that made her stop and think about a few things: Had anyone told her about what happened to Barry? Would she even care? Would she show a similar interest as Caitlin did and want to do her own tests? Would she be open to a group project? There was a lot to consider including what manner of things they could do with the little guy together and if maybe something else came out of their collaboration (having given up on Dr. Wells noticing her a LONG time ago) what was the harm?
So... (By the way if you choose option A, Wells has to name her, as in the original chapter Minimizer)

125322222222222222111211.content:
Zoom cackles as Barry's speed joins his own, the regenerative abilities held within healing his V-9 decay. Grinning madly the black eyed speedster turns to gaze to each of the assembled group, stopping momentarily on Wells, Jessie, Caitlin and Barry. 'Well I believe that's all I came here for, except...' he doesn't finish his words just grabs Barry's arm and runs, pulling him through a breach and back to his previous lair on Earth 2, flinging the former speedster against the wall as he stops.

'Why did you take me?'

'It's quite simple Barry, once I collected items from the people I killed, now I'm going to collect all the speedsters I destroy. Now where is she?' Zoom answers then turns and appears to search in confusion

'Oblivious moron' Barry hears the mutter of a female voice just to the left of him and so does Zoom as he immediately turns in that direction

'There you are' he growls and she enters Barry's field of view: this meta was in a near skin tight purple suit, with a thick black hood and as she turned her head he saw her face was covered in a mirrored mask, though her eyes shone through as silver orbs.

'You know what you must do' he hissed pointing a clawed glove to Barry 'then when you're done there are a few things I believe you'd...' a long bony fingered hand wrapped around a wrist which had (surprisingly slowly) been creeping it's way toward her sizable chest

'I would remind you Hunter, that the Speed Force won't protect you from my powers, and that I tell it go and to stop so killing me wouldn't save you. There are only 2 things you can't run from: Death and my smoak' there was a smirk in her tone as Zoom growled and pulled off his mask 'Better'

'Just do it' Hunter said through gritted teeth

'Oh course boss' she said sarcastically as she waved her hand and blue smoke filled Barry's vision

Before the cloud can even begin to fade he feels himself grabbed and sent flying through the air, landing in what feels to be some kind of box made of the same material as the last one he'd been forced into on Earth 2. Rolling onto his back he blinked his eyes into focus and flung himself back against the wall in fear and shock: on the other side of the glass wall was an absolutely enormous version of the mirror faced woman, Zoloman grinning manically a little further away though equally massive.

'A perfect victim as always dear, the name Minimizer suits you perfectly' he says casually as the woman waves him off

'What was the point in this?' she asks curiously

'I decided to track my progress of concurring the multiverse by collecting Flash's as I defeat and drain them of their powers. Using your powers they can't escape nor would there be much point if they did. That and I think you girls deserve a reward for your continued service, so as long as he stays alive you can do what you like with him'

'Thank you Hunter' Minimiser says running a finger along the outside of Barry's cage, the powerless speedster shaking so hard he was practically vibrating.

''Okay, I'm off, you girls have fun then'' Hunter grins as he leaves in a streak of blue, leaving Barry to stare in fear but also confusion as the mirror faced Minimiser was the only person here

'Oh don't worry we will' came a loud female voice and Barry cursed his luck as he turned and was shocked to see a smirking Caitlin... Killer frost half spread across the table he'd been placed on, along with Dr. Light (Linda Park) and Black Siren (Laurel Lance) both who had similar looks as they stared down at the tiny, helpless Barry. Luckily distraction came in the form of a monitor in the room lighting up and a distorted female voice calling out

'Okay guys he's left the city limits'

'Finally free of the bastard for a few hours' Dr. Light mutters

'Thanks Livewire (Not the Supergirl one, similar abilities but she's a Flash/Arrow character. Actually she's kind of like a human Rotom to use a Pokémon reference)' Siren said as she quickly knocked over Barry's 'cell' causing him to tumble onto the desk, the meta looking down at him with hungry eyes, licking her lips ... until she's repeatedly jabbed in the ribs

'Zoom said no killing' Minimizer stated flatly

'Like you listen to that bastard' Siren scoffed

'I do when it prevents massacres' was the annoyed reply 'One of us has to use our brains around here' she mutters but Siren could still hear her. Siren grits her teeth and inhales to prepare a sonic shriek, but then she notices the slight movements of her hands that Minimizer uses to direct her abilities and looking down she sees blue smoke covering her up to her ankles. Sighing loudly she relents 'Fine but I still get a turn'

'Wouldn't dream of stopping you. Now if you'll excuse me I have this claustrophobic thing to remove' Minimizer replies while waving her hand in the direction of her face. She pushes back her hood and raises a hand to either side of her head, a click was heard and the mask slid off nicely ''Really need to thank Le Fay for the mask idea'' she mutters now with her real voice audible

'Didn't Luther already owe you for what you did to the Kryptonian?' Livewire asks causing the formerly masked meta to chuckle

'True, Mor was happy to have me turn her former lover into her new plaything, don't think the other girl really complained that much either.' she smiles and turns allowing Barry to get a proper look at her and was shocked at the level of alteration her meta abilities had caused her.

Her skin was lavender and her hair was shimmering black at shoulder length. Her eyes were larger than they should be and her ears had pointed tips. Her smirk meant Barry could see the pointed teeth and thin black tongue. It took him a minute or 2 for him to see past all the physical changes and see the woman she'd once been... and he knew her.

Options for Minimiser are as follows

Sara Lance
Felicity Smoak (Otherwise she's Earth 2's Livewire)
Patty Spivot
Alex Danvers (for fun :D)

125322222222222222222222211.content:
Your eyes fluttered open slowly as you regained conciousness, letting out a soft groan as you blinked several times in confusion. You couldn't seem to remember what had happened, or where you were.

Moving your hands down you pushed yourself up off the ground and into a sitting position, before standing. Looking around, the surroundings were dark and dim, you couldn't make out much except shapes, but there was a light to our far right.

Walking across the ground towards the light, you saw it was a line of light which spanned across the ground, but noticed a large wall of fabric covering it, reaching down you pulled it up with some effort, and slid under it.

Instantly your surroundings were lit up as you came out on the other side of the fabric, and it took a few seconds for you to adjust.

When they did, you're eyes widened in shock and disbelief.

Morgan wasn't a bad kid in the slightest it's just do to some odd combination of genetics and Robin coming from a family of dark magic he was born tiny now only being an inch and a half. Because of that Chrom didn't spend very much time with him because he was afraid of hurting Morgan as he had a history breaking things and did not wish to hurt his son.

Chrom asked looking over to his wife who put the book down. "Yes I did, I had a good time with Morgan." Robin explained Chrom sighing in response, "What's wrong Chrom?" "I wish I could have an actual father-son relationship with Morgan but I'm afraid I will hurt him, I don't have that gentle touch you, Lucina, Aversa and some of the other girls have." Chrom explained to Robin who frowned, "Maybe tomorrow I can help teach you how to handle Morgan safely." Robin suggested before kissing her husband goodnight.

The Next Morning

Robin started stirring a bit then sat up now awake and looked over to Chrom, the tactician immediately making a

Noire went into the castles library where she saw her friend, Morgan on a ladder reaching for a book, until he lost his balance and fell. There used to be rumors that Noire had a crush on Morgan but were dispelled once it was revealed Noire was engaged to Owain.

"Hey Noire, how's it going?" Morgan asked as he picked himself up, putting books back on the shelf. "Listen Morgan I'm sorry but I have to do something and you're not gonna like it." Morgan tilted his head before Noire cast a combination of a sleep spell and shrink spell, shrinking the ten year old to an inch. "Oh mother is going to love you so much and if she doesn't, well I can always grow you back and pretend this never happened." Noire whispered as she put Morgan in a small box.

Noire knocked on her mothers door "Who is it?" Noire heard the muffled voice of Tharja. "Its Noire, I have a gift for you." Noire said and she heard a click.

Noire walked into the room seeing her mother in pajamas on the bed, Noire climbed on the bed and handed the box to Tharja, how does she react when she opens it?

It was a cold Winter’s morning, snow blanketed the ground. Robin was doing her early morning rounds, she only wore her coat as while she wasn’t necessarily fat, she weighed the most out of the female shepherds (Aversa not having been recruited….yet) so she handled the cold like a champ. She would walk to each of the tents to check on the shepherds. Right now she was making her way to her son, Morgan. Robin normally did whatever she could to prevent Morgan from participating in combat, yes he was perfectly capable of fighting as proven when they recruited him in the ruins of time. However he was only ten and Robin felt like it wasn’t fair to him to have to fight for his life at such a young age. Morgan did want to participate so what Robin did was have Morgan do a bunch of chores and helping out around camp.

Robin went into Morgan’s tent. “Morgan, sweetie, are you awake?” Robin asked poking her head in. “M-m-mom thank goodness you’re here!” Robin heard and she walked completely into the room. All she saw were Morgan’s nightclothes on the ground. “Morgan where are you?” Robin asked looking around the room. “D-d-down here” Robin heard Morgan’s voice coming from the discarded clothing. Robin lifted up the clothes, to Robin’s surprise Morgan fell out, an inch tall...and naked. “Morgan, what happened!?” Robin asked picking up Morgan, who was shivering. “W-w-well, you see, I noticed that you didn’t let me help out on the battlefield that much and I realized it’s because you don’t want to get hurt. So when we were at the previous town I passed by a guy in a bird mask selling some stuff, one of the things was a potion book. In it there was instructions of how to make an invincibility potion, I made it, drank it and I shrunk.” Morgan explained still shivering and blushing. Robin sighed, walked over the table and saw the book.

Robin looked at the book which was opened to the potion that Morgan was talking about. Robin read the page. “Morgan you’re a smart kid, but why in the world did you stop reading after the instructions?” “W-w-w-well, n-n-normally the instructions are at the end.” Morgan said twiddling his thumbs. “Morgan it says here that consuming this potion has seventy five percent chance of shrinking the person who consumes it.” Robin says and she continued reading the page and was frustrated by the fact that other everything else was written in a language that the grandmaster was unfamiliar with.

What does Robin do?

She then moved onto the kids, Gerome was alreay awake and alert, getting some early morning brooding done, Inigo stared almost drunkenly at her tits when she peeked into his tent, Kijelle threw a pillow at her and rolled over for more sleep and both Noire and Lucina greeted her politely with wide grins and asked how Morgan was doing today. Robin didn't quite lie when she said he was fine other than not liking how cold it was, to which Noire chuckled and said he was never a winter child, most likely due to his Plegian blood (which Robin would probably also have a problem with if she was thinner), while Lucina pouts and asks her to give him her best wishes.

Once she was sure everything was good Robin retreated to her own rather fancy tent, today was more a training day than anything else so the Grandmaster didn't have to worry about people noticing Morgan missing yet unlike if they were actually going somewhere as Marribelle would be anal about attendance and timing, so she would have had to tell everyone about her son's blunder if they were to go anywhere. As I stood nobody should be looking for Morgan until lunch at the earliest, maybe later if Robin claimed him to be sick so he couldn't come to the table himself.

What now?

She had black hair and a bored expression that is until her gaze focused on Morgan. “Hello little one, I am Queen Tharja. You must be wondering why you’re here. “Well Morgan let me show you something....interesting.” Tharja continued walking and there giant doors. Tharja opened them and Morgan gasped. On the floor wearing nothing but metal cuffs around her wrists and ankles was a giant woman, she was big enough that Tharja was basically doll in comparison. She had long white hair and red eyes. Her breasts were absolutely swollen. Due to her being on the floor and laying on her back Morgan couldn’t tell she had a massive rump as well. She was struggling and grunting obviously trying to escape.

“Morgan this here is Grima, she is my prisoner.” Tharja whispered moving Morgan so he was in front of her mouth. “But how?” Morgan asked mouth agape. “Well, before I became queen I was just a regular plegian citizen. One day Ylisse’s goddess Naga spoke to me in a dream. Apparently Grima was asleep in an underground tomb. Naga couldn’t open the tomb herself due to being a creature of light magic so she agreed that if I opened it for her she’d grant me power. I told her to give me the powers first, which she agreed to. It was a small amount but it was enough to claim the Plegian throne. After words I opened the tomb, Naga placed those cuffs on her which are made of the same material as Falchion. Those cuffs allow me to control Grima’s body. Naga made me swear that I cannot conquer any countries on the Ylissean continent.” Tharja explained to Morgan.

“Okay but why is Grima here specifically?” Morgan asked to the queen. “Well you see by drinking Grima’s milk it allows women and by women I mean me, to grow more and more. Oh another thing it’s feeding time.” Tharja smiled and snapped her fingers a large tube appeared and forced itself into Grima’s mouth. Grima moaned as her stomach started swelling like a balloon until it stopped when it was about the size of a bowling ball. “If Grima’s a goddess why are you feeding her and what are you feeding her?” Morgan asked whimpering. “I’m feeding her ambrosia the food of the gods, Naga has an invite supply she has, the tube connects to the fountain in Naga’s palace. If I brought you to Aversa and have you become a suitable queen of Plegia by the time you’d be old enough to rule Ylisse and Plegia would become one you would rule as queen.” Robin said astounding Lucina “but I’m not big like you, and from what you told me plegian women are big.”Lucina said Robin giggling “Silly girl, the reason you aren’t big like a plegian is because you don’t eat enough, yes plegian women are bigger than other women but they still require food to get bigger, heck if you didn’t have my plegian blood in particular you’d be two sizes smaller with how little food you ate.” Robin teased

Aversa moved it in front of the younger girls. “May I present to you prince Morgan of Plegia.” Aversa said opening up her hand revealing a half inch tall five year old with blue hair. “He’s so cute!” Lucina squeed snatching the small boy and rubbing him against her cheek. 145332221222221112112212222222122121.content:
One humid midsummer morning, Morgan tucked himself away in the Shepherds' magic supplies tent. He was wrapped in his typical indigo coat, slumping lazily on his wooden stool with a dusty tome open between his legs. A lone candle on his desk lit the cracked pages, its calm glow extending to the stacks of thick, musty books forming a half-circle around him. At his back, the entry flap swayed in the warm breeze, a sliver of rosy morning sunshine seeping through. Yet Morgan paid the outside world little mind. He was studying hard, intent on learning a spell or two to match the talents of his mother, Robin, and serve her well as a Shepherd.

"Okay," he whispered, flipping a page, "so, if I concentrate on the vibrations in the air… I should be able to-"

Morgan fell silent. The entry flap was thrown aside with dramatic flair. A red-pink ray struck his book, reflecting harshly on the beige pages and stinging his eyes. He spun around on his stool and squinted at the gleaming portal and the hourglass silhouette standing within it. She swayed into view as the flap fell shut behind her back, leaving her in appropriate shade.

Who is the woman who enters the tent?
145332221222221112112212222222122121.title: All chapters written by him will have a *

1453322212222211121122122222221221211.content:
It was none other than the dark mage Tharja, long black locks flowing from her head while a longer black cape hung from her back. A full-body stocking hugged her broad hips and slim waist, breasts and nethers teasingly veiled by gold-fringed garments. The enchantress drew the eyes of many impetuous men, the luckiest among them running for the hills before she could hex them. Lacking the maturity to appreciate her curves, Morgan only felt his skin crawl as her gaze landed on him.

"At last… I've found you."

"Th-Tharja," he stammered, slapping his tome shut, "um… were you looking for me? Heh… Are you sure you weren't trying to find my mother?" He nervously chuckled, trying to maintain a flicker of light in the face of Tharja's overwhelming darkness. It didn't last long.

"Oh, I am always seeking your mother, boy," she hissed, stepping forward. "With my powers, there's not a soul that can escape my sight. And yet..." She stopped just before Morgan, folding her arms under her chest.

What’s Tharja’s problem
1453322212222211121122122222221221211.title: Tharja *

14533222122222111211221222222212212111.content:
"Wh-what?"

Tharja bit her lip, averting her prideful gaze from Morgan's curious stare.

"I… have never been able to approach her myself."

Morgan cocked his head, smiling lightly.

"…Oh, really? Wow, Tharja, I never knew you were just shy! Maybe you could talk to In-"

"Shy!?" Her gaze snapped back onto the boy, shutting him up instantly. "Ha. How appropriately childish of you, Morgan. No, I simply loathe the slightest chance that my approach could be perceived as an act of aggression, shutting me off from Robin forever."

"Um… that still sounds like shyness to me."

"It is not! You see, this is why I need you, Morgan…"

Tharja took a step closer, bending over, her breasts hanging before Morgan's face. Blushing, he shrank into his seat, the turtleneck of his coat creeping up to his ears. He looked upward to see her hungry gaze looking back. She patted his head, pushing it deeper into his coat until only his eyes and hair were visible.

"Let us propose that, hypothetically, you were to… 'disappear…'"

Morgan gulped.

"…for a little while…"

Morgan sighed in relief.

"…down my throat."

Morgan turned pale as a rock. Tharja smiled.

"Then, while you sit in my stomach, your mother would enlist my assistance to find you. And with my assistance rendered, she'll have no choice but to…" Tharja grinned, standing up straight and laying her hands on her cheeks, blushing brightly. "…Pledge her gratitude to me! Oh, can you imagine how wonderful that would feel?"

"W-w-wait…" Morgan's head popped up from his collar, mouth agape. "You aren't seriously talking about… eating me, are you, Tharja? Y-you can't eat a human being, and even if you could, I'd be digested! And even if I wasn't, I'd tell my mother what you-"

Tharja laid a finger over Morgan's lips. She chuckled as she gave her own a lick.

"It's simple. I've learned a shrinking hex just for this occasion- it will render you invulnerable to harm, and when I'm ready to 'divine' for you, I need only cast a memory-altering spell… And you'll be just as thankful as your mother!"

She drew her finger back, a green spark sputtering at its tip aimed straight at Morgan. He shook his head, eyes wide in terror.

"N-no! You're nuts! You can't seriously be about to- hrk!"

A green bolt struck Morgan's chest, encapsulating him within an electric coat. Sparks blinded him, and when they faded, he found himself standing on a massive wooden platform stretching hundreds of feet in all directions. Looking up, he spotted the towering trunks of Tharja's pantyhose-clad thighs rising on the horizon. A grim shadow fell over him and invited his gaze higher, revealing Tharja's open hand descending, her face looming like a grinning moon.

Does she manage to grab Morgan?
14533222122222111211221222222212212111.title: Tharja’s plan *

145332221222221112112212222222122121111.content:
"Now… come to me, boy. I'm sure you'll be nice and warm in my belly… Hahahaha!… Ha?"

Tharja raised a brow. Her fingers had closed over nothing. Morgan swiftly sidestepped her grasp, prompting a gasp from them both. Neither of them expected the agility granted by his tiny size, but Morgan smiled because of it.

"Heh! I guess being a master of the dark arts doesn't improve your reflexes much, huh?"

"Grr…! Hold still, you little insect!"

Tharja made repeated grabs, but her prey slipped through her fingers every time, much to her increasing annoyance. Morgan gradually back-stepped to the stool's edge, glancing over his shoulder to confirm his escape route in the form of a stack of books under the desk. He spun around with a flick of his coat, dashing for the edge, only to feel a sharp tug that stopped him in his tracks. A throaty chuckle confirmed that Tharja had grabbed his coattail. She pulled upward and lifted him off the stool, but he raised his arms and slipped out of the sleeves. Morgan landed on solid ground in his milk-white undershirt and pants without losing a step. He hopped off the stool and landed on The Principles of Alchemy below the desk.

"Insolent brat," Tharja spat, shoving the stool aside, "you won't elude me that easily!"

The dark mage hunched over and reached under the desk. Morgan scurried down a short staircase of books leading to the tent's posterior flap, where a glimmer of sunlight peaked through. Tharja's open hand chased him for a good portion of his run, fingernails clawing at his heels until he jumped off one last book, landed on the tent's floor, and slipped underneath the flap. She snarled a curse, standing to her full height and stomping out of the tent.

Morgan shot out into the warm, pinkish sunlight, stopping to catch his breath. The ground was soggy from the nightly rainshower, dew resting on the scattered patches of grass that, from Morgan's height, seemed tall as trees. He raised his head to see a massive wall of dark fabric, belonging to a tent opposite the one he had just escaped from. Its lower rim was open a gap. With Tharja undoubtedly in pursuit, Morgan ran across the ground and ducked underneath. From his hiding spot, he glanced back and saw Tharja's massive heel stomping by.

"Now, where could that boy have gotten to…? Hm. I suppose I'll know soon enough."

"Aw, nuts," Morgan whispered to himself, "she's right. I bet she just went to grab a dragon scale and divine for me." If that was the case, he realized, he had no time to lose. He turned and crawled through the narrow passageway. It really didn't matter who he found- he just needed someone who could keep him safe from Tharja. Then again, she might just be crazy enough to shrink someone else…

"Well, I might as well try- ouf! …Hm?"

As Morgan stood up from under the flap, he bumped his head against a soft ceiling. It was impressively wide, ending at a thin rectangle of light toward the end. He pressed on, crouching a bit to prevent his hair from dragging against the ceiling. The nearer he drew to the light, the clearer the tent's interior became. A fuzzy area rug covered the whole floor, a table standing at its center topped by several candles. Cots and shelves ran along the fringes of the room. It was the main sleeping tent of the camp which, Morgan immediately recalled, was where Robin slept.

"Wait, this is perfect! Mom could fix me right up! …But I wonder if she's even here?"

Is she there?
145332221222221112112212222222122121111.title: A daring escape *

1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.content:
Morgan stepped out from under the low ceiling. He turned around to see a large mattress towering over him, its topside totally obscured. As he assumed, he had been crawling underneath one of the cots. He turned and continued looking around, but from what he could tell, the tent was empty.
"Well, that answers my question. Hmm. Wait a minute… If Tharja catches me alone in here, she could just eat me without any witnesses! Crud, I should've thought about this more…"

Morgan paused. Looking between the legs of the central table, he saw the entry flap rising and falling with the wind. "Well, I could still head back outside. Maybe someone out there would help? …Or maybe I'd run into Nowi. Gah. At least Tharja was planning on letting me out of her stomach eventually... What should I- wha!?"

In the end, Morgan's choice was made for him. A harsh quake vibrated through the rug, throwing him face-first into the fuzz. He rolled over and sat up, beholding a pair massive feet, each big toe large enough to flatten him. They rose into towering ankles, widening into thighs that entered a pair of navy blue shorts. Above the shorts sagged a sky-blue shirt, finally ending at the soft, weary face of Morgan's older sister, Lucina. Her disheveled blue hair fell in frizzy locks over her shoulders, cobalt eyes fluttering as she stretched and yawned.

"Ahhhhh… Good morning…"
"S-sister…?" Morgan's jaw hit the floor. He sat there, at the foot of his giant sister's bed, along with her actual foot. She shook her head, wiping the crust from her twitching eyelids and slowly surveying the floor.
"Mm… Alright, time to… wait."

Lucina paused. Her blurry vision revealed a tiny, pale-colored object by her toes. She spread her legs and bent down for a better look. She wondered if it was a bug, until it stood up and showed it had only four limbs. In fact, closer inspection revealed it to look quite human. A dark line divided its body into a white shirt and pants. On its head sat a dark blue tuft of hair bracketing its cubbish, smiling face. Lucina's eyelids flung wide open. She was looking at a living, breathing boy, one who was small as her thumb, with features that could belong to only one.

"B…but… It can't be…! Oh gods! Morgan!?"

Morgan chuckled nervously, scratching the back of his head as he looked up at Lucina's bewildered face.

"Um, yeah... Good morning, Sister!"

"Wh-what…? H-how are you- I must be dreaming… But I can't be! But then… Are you real?"

"Well, only one way to find out," Morgan shrugged and smiled, "Give me a hand, sis!"

"…Okay."

Lucina lowered a flattened palm to the floor by Morgan's side. He stepped on and took a seat, the warm, squishy skin heating his legs. She slowly raised him to her face as she straightened her back, trying to be as gentle as possible. Morgan gasped nonetheless, having never ridden a human hand as an elevator before, watching the floor shrink away beneath him. When the ride ended, he stared up at her panoramic visage and the uncombed blue frizz framing it. Her mouth remained agape and her eyes remained wide.

"I… can't believe it's really you. You're so small!"

"Yeah," he nodded, "I guess I'm really your 'little' brother now, huh?"

Lucina closed her eyes and shook her head with a sigh.

"Alright… it's definitely you." She opened her eyes and matched her younger brother's warm smile. "Well, I'm always glad to see you, Morgan. Although, this is still very strange… holding you in my hand like a doll. What happened to you?"

"Well, it all started when I was in the magic supplies tent…" Morgan's explanation rambled on for a while. Over the course of his story, Lucina's fingers slowly curled into a defensive cup behind his back, her eyes growing wider by the minute. By the time he concluded, she looked totally dumbfounded. "…So basically, Tharja wants to eat me! Um… You do believe me, right, Sister?"

Lucina offered a slow, solitary nod. "Yes, I believe you… but I wish I didn't. I'd like to trust each of my fellow Shepherds equally."

"Right," Morgan folded his arms behind his head, reclining against Lucina's curved fingers, "I don't like judging people on first appearances, but… Yeah. Tharja's always kinda creeped me out. And she's probably still out there looking for me…"

Lucina flinched. Her hand closed tighter around Morgan, fingers curling over his head forcing him to bend his back.

"Whoa, easy there, Lucina!" He raised his hands and pushed against her fingers, as if to trying to slow their descent, even though he knew it was impossible. "I'm sure I'll be fine in your hands without you crushing me with 'em!"

Lucina shook her head, as if snapping out of a trance. She unfurled her fingers, allowing Morgan to recline like before.

"S-sorry. It's just… the thought someone capturing you scares me." She shrugged, managing a smile. "I guess it's a 'big sister' thing. You may be older now, but it'll always be my job to protect you, you know? Especially if you're shrunken like this. With everyone running around camp, who knows what could happen to you?"

"Y-yeah," Morgan chuckled, fearfully daydreaming of being squished under a clumsy Sumia or swallowed by a playful Nowi. "Still, I think I'll be okay. Tharja said she made me tough enough to survive in her stomach, after all. Then again… she's definitely still looking to trap me in there. She'll do anything if it means getting closer to mom. Speaking of mom, I was thinking we should find her to get me unshrunk. I'm not good enough with magic to undo this hex, but I bet she'd know what to do."

"Yes, I had the same thought. Although… Mother should be coming here any moment. I was going with her to that town as a fellow ambassador."

"Really? So, does that mean we'd be better off staying here?"

How does Lucina answer
1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.title: Morgan’s BIG Sister *

1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.content:
"Mhm…" Lucina offered another slow, singular nod. Her eyelids shut halfway, while her smile grew just a little wider. "So, we'll just be waiting a while, huh…"

"I guess that's the plan," Morgan shrugged, "but are you okay, Lucina? You've got kind of a funny look, almost like when you had a fever that one time..."

"Mm? I don't know what you're talking about… hehe."

"I mean, maybe you're still a little sleepy, but- whoa!"

Lucina swung her legs back onto the mattress, splaying them over the blankets while resting her back against the pillows. Morgan found that Lucina's hand was lowering, cradling him over her thigh. Her hand tilted, allowing him to slide off and land in the corner between leg and waist, resting his back against her lower abdomen. The same hand flipped over and gently rested over his legs, pushing him into the soft, warm fabric. Her stomach rose and fell behind his back with her slow, relaxed breaths, squeezing him between the fluff of her shirt and the warmth of her fingers, her pulse throbbing under her skin. Her eyes drifted down at the tiny brother lying in her lap.

"Hehe… Comfy down there?"

"O-oh, um… Lucina…" He looked up toward his sister's face as she peered down with a loving smile. "Not that I mind this or anything, but what's gotten into you today?"

"I'm sorry. It's just… with all the time we spend out there fighting, we never have much time to just relax, huh? Just to be a family once in a while."

"Huh, you have a point. I've thought about that too, it's just… I guess I'm more used to the 'new' you, y'know?"

"Oh?" Lucina raised a brow. "There's a 'new' me?"

"W-well, yeah! Er… Y'know… the gruff attitude, the flashy sword stuff, the whole 'mask' thing…"

Lucina chuckled, smiling warmly. Morgan returned her smile, though there was something about it that he couldn't quite place. Nothing devious like Tharja's, but something distant, uncanny, nostalgic perhaps. Especially as she tilted her head to the side, resting her cheek against her fist…

"You're adorable, Morgan. Just like you've always been."

"Oh, wait a minute… Ha!" Morgan laughed, pointing at Lucina's face. "That's what I'm remembering!"

"Huh?" Lucina realigned her head, raising her cheek from her fist. That fist sprouted a finger that joined Morgan's in aiming back at her face. "What about this look?"

"It's the one you used to give me when I was a little kid. When we used to play around and you'd always giggle about how 'cute' I was… haha!"

Lucina playfully blushed.

"Hey, that's not funny! And don't you dare tell anyone around here that I 'giggled!'"

"But you totally did! Like, when you used to stomp around, pretending to be a 'giantess' who was trying to eat me! Then you'd give me a chance to fight back and 'slay' the giantess, but… Man, I was such a softie!"

"What are you-" Lucina's words were caught in her throat, blocked off by a snicker. "Oh, ha! That's right! You never 'slayed' anything…"

"…Because I couldn't bring myself to hurt you, even if we were just pretending! Ha… I sure was weird, huh? I always hear about siblings getting into fights, but I never wanted to fight with you."

"Oh, Morgan…" Lucina sighed, shaking her head. "The only thing that's unusual about you is that you're too kind. And if that's your biggest problem, you should consider yourself blessed. I should, too, since I have you as a brother."

"Aw, thanks!" Morgan threw his arms up, as if reaching out to catch a ball bigger than his whole body. Lucina giggled, laying a hand over her lips as if to seal all silliness inside her.

"Hee hee… Oh my gosh! What's with that pose?"

"Oh, sorry," Morgan dropped his arms and chuckled, "I just remembered how our game always ended, with me giving the 'giantess' a big hug! Heheh…"

"A big hug for the giantess, huh?" Lucina's smile broadened. "You mean… like this?"

"What are you- uwah!?"

Lucina's free hand swooped in and scooped Morgan up, eliciting a brief yelp as he was elevated. But, rather than bringing him before her face, her hand stopped at her collarbone. She rested her other arm diagonally over her chest, forming a small gap between skin and cloth. She tilted her hand, letting him slide comfortably into the crevice, lightly pressing her arm inward to secure him.

Morgan slipped up to his waist before Lucina tightened her "hug," squeezing him against the soft, warm cloth. His head rose just above the collar of her shirt, his face nestling against the crest of her smooth skin. Lucina lowered her head and hummed affectionately, nuzzling her brother's delicate frame between the two soft planes. Morgan wiggled his hands free of the constrictive cloth, awkwardly spreading his arms to embrace as much of his sister as he could. He barely managed a fraction of her warm, plush breadth, but she giggled lovingly his attempt nonetheless, keeping him a while longer.

Eventually, Lucina brought Morgan back up to her face. She sat cross-legged on her bed while he sat cross-legged in her hand, the two of them smiling as brightly as ever.

"Heh. Sorry about the lousy hug, sis."

"It's alright! To be fair, you had a hard time wrapping your arms around me when you were little, too!"

"Heheheh… But that didn't stop me from trying, huh?"

"Nope! Hahaha…" Lucina shook her head, her laughs trailing off into a sigh. "Wow. I can't believe we used to play around like this every day. It feels so long ago… But it feels nice right now."

"Yeah. And we haven't even done any of the crazy stuff yet!"

"Ohh?" Lucina's eyes narrowed naughtily. "Are you saying you want to do the 'crazy stuff?'"
1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.title: She doesn’t really answer (reserved)

1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.content:
"Uh, well… I dunno, mom's probably-"

"Aw… C'mon Morgan! It'll be fun! And this could be the only time you're shrunken, so why not mess around with it? Trust me, when you're older, you'll want to relive your childhood every day... I know that feeling all too well," she concluded with a roll of her eyes.

"Alright, If you insist! But, what was your idea?"

"Well…" Lucina let out a mischievous giggle, licking her lips.

"Wait… I hope you don't mean we're going straight to-"

Morgan yelped. His platform swooped down toward the mattress as Lucina let out a demented sounding giggle. With a tilt of her hand, he rolled onto the blanket, sprawled about before her folded legs, which didn't stay folded for much longer. She sprung up onto her knees, chest puffed out comically with a hand laid on her hip, putting on her best "evil" performance.

"Mwahaha… The giantess comes, and she hungers for human flesh! You'd best be running away, my little morsel! Not that you'll get very far before I snatch you up and gobble you whole!"

Morgan couldn't help but laugh. So many memories came flooding back as he stood to his feet, wobbling a bit in search of balance on the swaying mattress.

"I don't know about that, sis! I slipped away from Tharja, I'm sure I can get away from- wha!?"

Lucina wasn't messing around. She immediately swiped for Morgan with an open hand. He hopped backward just barely in time. He then turned and tried to run, repeatedly stumbling and falling, crawling on all fours when he couldn't manage to stand. Thankfully, Lucina was similarly afflicted, barely able to keep up her "gigantic" stature as she waddled forth on her knees, nearly toppling over. The slow, awkward chase continued to the end of the bed, where Morgan had managed to outpace the 'giantess.' But she had one last trick up her sleeve, lurching forward and throwing her hand forth. As she thudded against the blanket, she produced a massive shockwave that undulated the whole mattress. Morgan was launched into the air, legs fluttering helplessly as he fell into Lucina's open palm, her fingers enclosing him. She crawled over to the bedside with Morgan in hand and sat up, dangling her legs off edge. Finally, she brought her 'prey' up to her mouth, her earnest smile replaced by a victorious smirk.

"Haha! I've got you now! Now you're all mine, hahaha…"

"Darn. I'm guessing hugs won't save me this time?"

"Sure… if you wanna hug the inside if my belly! Haha!"

Lucina gripped Morgan by his shirt with her free hand, hoisting him above her mouth while tilting her head back. Her jaws parted wide beneath him, a wave of warm morning breath washing over his legs. In the low light of the tent, her teeth were a pair of monstrous jaws emerging from an inky black fog, her shimmering serpent of a tongue unrolling just beneath his feet. Her breath grew hotter and hotter as she dangled him lower and lower. He looked down, the pink throat arch just barely visible, twitching as if in genuine anticipation.
1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.title: He needs a little convincing *

1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.content:
"Aw, c'mon, Lucina! Don't tease about eating me right after-"

The tent's entry flap was brushed aside. Lucina's hand opened, and instantly she felt a small, cloth-covered object plop onto her tongue. She kept her head pointed forward, her ears greeted by the last voice she wanted to hear.

"Lucina. Robin's daughter. Do you fare well?"

It was Tharja. Lucina felt a chill run down her spine, and Morgan apparently did too. He wiggled on her tongue and flipped onto his back. She heard the slightest squeak from him before she shut her mouth, sealing him inside. Just for a moment, she assured herself, to buy some time.

Inside Lucina's maw, Morgan watched the teeth clack shut, sealing him in steamy darkness. The squishy tongue twitched beneath him, expanding and contracting like a sponge, secreting saliva between its bumpy pores. His back was soaked, and his front wasn't faring much better with moist breath blowing over his face. The smell wasn't terribly pleasant, and all he could hear was the clenching and unclenching of the throat muscles, producing a wet sucking sound. That sound soon joined by a deep, reverberating moan. Morgan found himself sliding slightly forward and slightly back as Lucina's head tilted up and down.

"Mmm… hm." Lucina answered with a subtle nod, taking care not to send Morgan down her throat. She watched Tharja pace around the table, arms folded and head facing forward.

"I was searching for someone. Your brother, Morgan." She shot a glare at Lucina. "You wouldn't have happened to see him around here, would you?"

"Mm-mm," she shook her head.

"Well, that's understandable." She realigned her head and nodded. "I was assisting him with learning a new spell, but- oh, the poor boy. You know how excitable they can get at his age. He shrunk himself to a few inches, so you must understand I am very concerned for his safety."

"Mm… hm," she nodded noncommittally. She couldn't believe this witch was really as cold as they said, but there was another reason for her dissonant reply. There was also the tiny body resting upon her tongue, a strangely alluring flavor washing over the wet muscle. She was so lost in the salty, tangy sensation of that she almost forgot she was tasting her own brother, and that Tharja was still speaking to her.

"…Because I just got done divining his location… you truly not seen him… scurrying around?"

"Mmm… mmh…" Lucina heard Tharja's words trail off into babble. She started tilting her tongue left and right, absorbing every bit of Morgan's taste she could. He slipped and slid all over the slick muscle, wiggling in protest, lathery bubbles filled with his essence bursting all over. There was no mistaking it. He was delectable. But was he delicious enough to eat, Lucina wondered? He did say that Tharja's spell rendered him capable of surviving digestive acids. And he was delicious. And she wondered, somewhat naughtily, what it would be like to give her little brother a "hug" with her throat, feeling him inside her body, squirming around…

"Lucina."

The swordswoman jerked. Her blue pupils expanded as they met with Tharja's dark gaze, her scowling face was mere inches from her own. How long had she been there?

"…You're being awfully quiet. Mind telling me where you last saw Morgan?"

A bead of sweat rolled down Lucina's forehead, crossing between her eyes and dripping off her nose. She knew Morgan wouldn't like it, but she also loved him. It wasn't like he would be harmed. Besides, what choice did she have? It was either her stomach or Tharja's, but she'd let him out sooner. Clenching her fist, she tilted her tongue back, pushing her little brother back toward her throat.

"Uh-oh… now what?"

Inside Lucina's mouth, Morgan sat up, bumping his head against the mouth's roof. He had been listening to the muffled sound of Tharja's voice outside, but mysteriously, she had fallen silent. He figured it was only a matter of time before Lucina's mouth would open, dooming him to confinement Tharja's stomach instead... but he was surprised to feel Lucina's tongue shift and bow. The fleshy wedge curled inward, its firm tip pressing against chest, forcing him onto his back while folding over his legs. Morgan felt his whole world tilt as the fleshy blanket slipped free of his lower body and he slid straight into the waiting throat below. He felt a ring of muscle stretch over his head, sliding over his forearms as it slowly tightened, abruptly clenching to squeeze him downward.

"L-Lucina! Wai-"

Gulk~

Lucina twitched. Half her mind worried Tharja would realize the true nature behind her gulp and know it not to be a simple sign of fear. But the other half was too busy enjoying Morgan's wiggly little form sliding down her throat. She relished every little twitch as he passed from her neck to the inside of her chest, squeezing his way through lower esophageal sphincter and plopping into the pit of her stomach. He felt just as nice inside her throat as she had hoped, but the sound of Tharja loudly clearing her own throat brought her back to the present.

"S-sorry, Tharja. I'm afraid the last time I saw him was yesterday."

Does Tharja believe Lucina
1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.title: Tharja Returns *

1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.content:
"…Really. Well. I'll be on my way then."

Tharja turned toward the door, walking toward the entry flap. Lucina stared.

"Just like that?"

Lucina nonetheless counted every second before the dark mage was gone, but when the entry flap fell shut, her shoulders dropped with a heavy sigh. Then she shuddered. Morgan skittered around her stomach floor in quick, jerky movements. He eventually stopped and slumped against the internal wall, tickling the sensitive muscle. Lucina hunched over, speaking to her stomach.

"M… Morgan? Can you hear me?"

"Yeah," Morgan replied, muffled behind the visceral layers, "loud and clear!"

"That's good… I can hear you too." Lucina blinked. She was amazed that she could hear the voice of a living thing inside her, let alone her own brother. "So you're… okay in there? You're not melting?"

"Nope! I can feel the acid, but it's just kinda warm and mucky… And it doesn't smell great, but I can manage."

"So, you can… breathe alright?"

"That had me stumped at first, but I think it's just another part of the hex. Like, it was designed for maximum stomach-comfort! Heheh…"

"And you're… sure you're okay?"

"Yeah! C'mon, Lucina, you're the hungry giantess! I thought you'd enjoy it a little more!"

"Hehehe…" Lucina bit the tip of her pinkie. "I can't believe you still have a sense of humor even in this situation… Because… Well… I'm sorry for swallowing you so suddenly. It felt like you were really freaking out in there."

"Hey, don't sweat it, sis! It was kinda scary at first, sliding down into a dark, slimy hole like that... But once I got into your throat, it felt nice, like a full-body massage. I don't know, maybe it's just the hex. Maybe it was created to condition the 'captive' into staying relaxed inside of the captor's stomach… Either way, this is kind of cool!"

"Whoa… really? You think it's cool… in my stomach?"

"Well, actually, it's very warm. But just seeing the inside of a living stomach up-close like this is totally cool! Like, I was reading a book about human anatomy, and now I wanna go back and rewrite it! It's waaaay different… And… I know I said this already, but… maybe it's the hex, or… mmm… I dunno, it's just… it's so… comfy…"

"Wait, what are you- Ohhh…"

Lucina shivered, her upper body standing erect. She felt Morgan's tiny form plop into the pit of her stomach, his little arms spread as he sank into the muscle. Such a simple gesture, but that little squeeze, that little shift of his weight, flooded her senses with bliss. She sat totally still, time seeming to fade from her conscience, nearly reclining against the wall and falling back asleep. But a faint moan from within her drew her attention downward. She arched her back and directed her ear toward her stomach, listening for Morgan's voice amidst her stomach's watery sloshing.

"Hey… sis?"

"…Yes, little brother?"

"…Thanks for protecting me…"

"…Of course, Morgan. I would do anything for you."

"Lucina? Who are you talking to?"

"Huh!?"

Who is it
1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.title: Safe in the Stomach *

1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.content:
Lucina looked up to see Robin standing before the entry flap, clad in her black tactician's coat with a tome in hand. She tapped a finger against her chin, giving her daughter a slightly disappointed look. "And you still aren't dressed…? I was hoping you'd be ready before I got here. And where is Morgan? Weren't you speaking to him just now?"

Lucina smiled, laying a hand on her stomach. "Well, where to start…"

_ _ _

Minutes passed outside the command tent, more than the driver of the horse-drawn coach awaiting Robin's return had expected. Eventually, the flap opened and he saw her. She stepped alongside her daughter Lucina, who had donned trademark blue leather armor, her hair combed into a set of straight cobalt bangs. Morgan stepped out soon after, still slipping his arms into a newly-prepared indigo coat as he hurried alongside his mother and sister. The coach had no canopy, but it did have opposing seats for four, so the three easily boarded together. Lucina and Morgan sat in the back, while Robin, seated in the front, turned and signaled the driver to start. As the horses trotted along, pulling the coach forward, she turned back around to see both her children smiling. As was often the case, Morgan spoke first.

"Thanks for letting me come along, Mother!"

"Of course, Morgan! But you know, if you're ever trying to expand your knowledge of magic, you could just come to see me."

"Aw, I know. I just wanted to impress you, that's all! Y'know, show how independent I've become, and all that… Sorry, is that arrogant of me?"

"Not at all, kiddo," Robin assured, patting Morgan's head, "that's a good trait to have. But you can always count on your family for support, no matter what happens. Magic is especially hard to learn on one's own. I'm surprised you got as far as you did. Although," she added with a wink, "I could always show you how to cast the shrinking hex on yourself with an easy way to undo it… If you two were interested in more 'stomach bonding.'"

Morgan and Lucina blushed lightly.

"Um," Morgan mumbled, "well, I-"

"M-mother," Lucina cut in, looking around at the camp as they rolled by, "Do we have to discuss this in public?" She glanced at Morgan before continuing. "And I don't think it's a practical use of Morgan's time to teach him magic that will only be useful for two people…"

Robin waited a moment. She laughed as her children's cheeks glowed red as the morning sun.

"WAIT!" Lucina shrieked, waving her hands. "No, no! Wait! I didn't mean it like-"

"You two are such a handful," Robin sighed with a shake of her head. "And who said it was just for you? I thought Morgan was pretty cute when he was small, too. So…" She paused, patting her son's knee. "What do you say, Morgan?"

"Heh… heh… Well…" Morgan's gaze danced between his mother and sister, finally settling on the latter. "I mean, it's like you said, sis… no harm in having some fun with it, right?"

"…Ah, sure," Lucina shrugged, her smile returning, "why not?"
1453322212222211121122122222221221211111.title: Settling Down *

14533222122222111211221222222221.content: Robin didn’t know how she got into this situation. She was 9 months pregnant very, very close to the due date; yet here she was shrunken to an inch tall her older sister, Aversa gently rubbing her swollen gut. “Aversa I’m still not sure that this is a good idea” Robin whimpered as Aversa rubbed her in circles with her pointer finger. “Oh, stop being a worry wart, nothing’s going to happen to the baby.” Aversa said with a small smile. “Okay if you say so, AHH!” Robin’s water had broken. Wasting no time; Aversa had reversed the spell on Robin bringing her back to her normal size. While Aversa was helping Robin deliver the baby she had heard the door swing open. “Robin, oh gosh the baby’s coming!” Aversa had heard the voice of Chrom, her brother in law. Aversa heard frantic footsteps making her think Chrom had run off to a variety of doctors, Lissa and Lucina. “Seems like Morgan is done waiting, let’s hope this is smooth.” Aversa said (Robin and Chrom had already decided on a name for the baby). As if right on time as soon as the baby came out Chrom, Lissa, Lucina and some doctors were there. “It’s a lovely little boy” Aversa said bringing the baby up to Robin. “Aversa, the baby is tiny” Robin said, of course she was happy the baby was born safely and was healthy and of course she would love him, however he was tiny and up until today he was normal sized. “Aversa, please tell me you didn’t plan for this to happen; did you?” Chrom asked worried about his sister-in-law’s intentions, he did get along with Aversa often but she was still unpredictable at times. “Of course, not I specifically made sure not to use any spells that would permanently affect the baby.” Aversa reassured to the Exalt, however; is Aversa lying?

145332221222221112112221.content:
Lucina took a deep breath, finally she would be able to back into the past and save the world. Yes there was the problem that when going through the time portal they could all get separated but Lucina had a plan for that.

Lucina went outside to see her allies and friends: Noire, the daughter of Henry and Tharja. Severa, daughter of Cordelia and Gaius. Yarne, son of Panne and Kellam. Nah, daughter of Nowi and Ricken. Cynthia, daughter of Sumia and Frederick. Laurent, son of Miriel and Vaike. Kjelle, daughter of Sully and Virion. Inigo, son of Olivia and Donnel. Brady, son of Maribelle and Gregor. Gerome, son of Cherche and Libra. Lucina's cousin, Owain, the son of Lissa and Lon'Qu. And last but not least Lucina's ten year old brother, Morgan, the son of Robin and Chrom.

"Now everyone this is the moment we've been waiting for and I know you are all nervous, I am too. But if we all stick together we can get through this!" Lucina said with confidence. "I hate to be a debby downer, Luci but Naga said so herself that we might all get separated." Brady said, Lucina looked towards him with a small smile. "Thank you for bringing that up Brady, I actually have solution that will fix that, now none of you will like it, except maybe Morgan, but it will work and it's for the greater good."

At that Lucina opened her palm and there was a bright flash of light. When Lucina could see properly all of her friends were one to six inches tall (To be more specific and stuff, Morgan was one, Noire, Severa and Kjelle were six and everyone else was between.)

Everyone looked pretty freaking terrified, except Morgan who was really giddy standing in awe of his massive sister. "Now don't be scared, I need you to remove your armor and weapons." Lucina said calmly, the little people obeying her words.

"S-s-s-so why did you want us to remove our gear?" Noire stuttered as Lucina put the stuff in a small pouch. "Well so I would have an easiee time eating you." Lucina said casually and with the excption of Laurent, Gerome and Morgan, everyone started panicking. "Guys calm down, the spell I used to shrink you also makes you invincible." Lucina sighed as the others still panicked, Yarne tried to run away but Lucina quickly grabbed him and ate him, gagging a bit as he was nasty due to his fur.

After Yarne was swallowed everyone shut up. "What's going to be done about Minerva?" Gerome asked "Yeah and my Pegasus!?" Cynthia piped in and Lucina sighed once more. Unfortunately we'll have to leave them behind the shrink spell only works on things with human blood and the things they have on them." Lucina explained right before she ate Gerome and Cynthia in case if they thought they would run off or complain.

152322222221121.content:
You awaken with a throbing headache, unsure of where you are or were or even what was going on. Opening your eyes you find yourself leaning against the wall of a wooden building/house, staring over at an enormous white stone wall/barricade. Somewhere in your mind you knew this would be perfectly normal... if you weren't 6 inches tall right now.
Before you have much more time to think about it there was an rush of energy in the air whch knocks the wind from you, though you somehow manage to stay standing, followed by a shadow blocking out the light in the surrounding area.

'Well what do we have here?' a female voice says and you begin to worry. Someone had found you, but who is it?
152322222221121.title: Soul Society

1523222222211211.content:
You look up and see the shadow was caused by a woman with what would be considered short dark hair, except that there were 2 long, thin braids ending in metal rings that reached mid back. Her head was tilted in a look of curiosity which showed within her grey eyes. She wore what seemed to be a white cape, black pants, black backless, sleeveless outfit over her front and flat, Chinese shoes.
Under normal circumstances Soi Fon would be quite a small woman, but compared to you right now she looked to be larger than the seireitei. She quickly slipping into a crouched position to get a better look at you, you blush (and hope she doesn't notice) as even though she's rather petite [and rather cute] given how close she appeared when she found you, nearly stepping on you, you were standing between her feet and with her change in position if she got any lower you'd be pressed against her firm looking thighs.

'How did this happen?' she asked, you keeping your head lowered in embarrassment 'I-I don't know, I don't remember anything' you answer, missing the frown on her previously calm features 'Well that's unhelpful, but you do obviously have quite a good bit of reiatsu in that little body of yours, that's one thing in your favour' she comments, you actually looking up at her face in confusion 'What so you mean?' 'Well I'm standing over your tiny body and you're... embarrassed rather than suffocating on my spiritual pressure' You just look blankly in her direction 'I don't understand' Soi's eyebrows quirk 'you don't know what I am?' she asks and you shake your head, the giantess sighed in annoyance, wondering why you were such an idi... amnesia.
Sighing once more she took a deep breath 'This...' she begins pointing to her haori '...means I'm very powerful if you didn't have at least the potential to reach a similar level then you'd be in quite a bit of pain right now, even more given our size difference which I know thanks to Suzume-baka' she hisses the last part and you feel her energy spike as a shiver runs through your entire body. 'So what now?' you ask 'Now, you come with me to the Squad 2 barracks' she answers, a small smile flashed across her features 'What?' 'People with spirit energy as strong as you would normally be need to eat and other necessities similar to in the world of the living, I don't think you'll survive that long out her at your current size, so it's either with me and potentially be a future Squad 2, or I send for Nemu and you become the newest pet project of Squad 12's science division' she explains and you pale before nodding in understanding 'Um, okay then. I guess I'm sticking with you'
'Well now that's decided off we go' Soi announced as she reached down and grabbed you 'Oh wait, if I head back at the speed I normally use, you'll be blown away if you're just sitting in my hand, I'll have to put you somewhere' she thinks out loud before placing you...
1523222222211211.title: Soi Fon

15232222222112111.content:
With the hand not holding you she pulled the side of her backless outfit away, then pushed you up into her slight cleavage before letting go and allowing the near skin tight cloth to regain it's hold then continuing her route. Soi may not have the largest bust, particularly if she's being compared to her predecessor, or even fellow Captain Unohana, but what she had in combination with her uniform was more than enough to keep you pinned by her soft flesh.

This was one hell of a strange day for you: waking up shrunk with no memory of anything before this, found by a rather cute though serious looking woman who suddenly picks you up exposes one of her breasts to you (and revealing that if not sans underwear, at the very least she goes bra-less) before pushing you between then and zooming off at high speed as you were roughly jostled around, trying not to move too much else she'll call you a pervert and at your size she could do a lot of damage if you angered her, but at the speed she was going even her chest jiggled.

Finally making it back to the Squad 2 barracks, more specifically her office Soi collapsed into her chair, kicking off her shoes with a groan before turning to her paperwork with a tired sigh. Her feet were killing her, it was only the fact that she'd training her balance to a razor's edge in that even his slight weight could fuck it up, that saved him from being used as the captains insole or cushion.

She sighed tiredly as she lay back in her seat, she knew she should let the little guy out and see if he was worth the effort of training, but on the other hand he did feel rather nice where she'd left him, lightly squeezing her breasts to get a reaction as she contemplates just making him her official stress toy, playing with him might do a better job for making her feel better than punching her useless lieutenant (thought also make the man even more useless) particularly if he could be taught the points that worked her up the best. She licked her lips before her gaze dropped to her small chest in contemplation.

So business or pleasure?
